availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander W. Nickell (Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer, laborer, and soldier. Illinois native. Married to Katherine Salyer Nickell in Johnson County, Kentucky, on February 4, 1847. Father of Samantha Nickell, Silvia Nickell, Melissa Nickell, John L. Nickell, Matilda F. Nickell, William Nickell, and Ellen Nickell. Farmer in Johnson County in 1850. Laborer in Morgan County in 1860. Mustered into the 5th Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private on October 25, 1861. Served in the 1st Capital Guard Regiment in the Kentucky State Militia as first lieutenant and captain from August 9, 1864, to March 11, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 95B-96A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 57.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kansas, Shawnee County, Tecumseh, p. 150A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Johnson County Marriages, Film #001912950, p. 205 of 239 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 774.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), p. 198.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 111.
Find A Grave, "Alexander Washington Nickell (1828-1903)," Memorial #29485584, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/29485584 (accessed October 2, 2018).
